author: Joshua Fluke
description:
LinkedIn used to be for professionals. Now it’s where CEOs write diary entries that sound like failed TED Talks. One’s watering grass for engagement, another’s charging employees for snacks, and one startup holds silent dinners because “fun is a distraction.”

Oh, and a CEO literally got fired for helicoptering at a company party. Yeah—this is the professional platform.

It’s Facebook for executives who think metaphors are leadership. Let’s scroll through the madness.

title: CEOS ON LINKEDIN ARE LOSING IT!
